meanings.sent1: The salesman tried to sell me a shonky product.
meanings.sent2: I don't trust that shonky website with my personal information.
meanings.sent3: His shonky excuses for being late didn't fool anyone.
meanings.sent4: The shonky contractor cut corners and left us with a mess.
meanings.sent5: The shonky character in the movie always had a hidden agenda.

meanings.sent1: The shonky toy broke after just a few minutes of play.
meanings.sent2: I received a shonky gift that fell apart as soon as I opened it.
meanings.sent3: The shonky umbrella couldn't even withstand a light breeze.
meanings.sent4: The shonky bridge swayed alarmingly in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The shonky phone case cracked easily under pressure.

meanings.definition: To behave in a deceitful or underhanded manner
meanings.sent1: He tried to shonky his way out of trouble by lying.
meanings.sent2: She shonkyed her competitors by spreading false rumors.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to shonky its way into getting extra treats.
meanings.sent4: The politician shonkyed his promises to win votes.
meanings.sent5: The student shonkyed his way to a passing grade by cheating.
